people_also_ask.question: Why Is Grim Fandango called Grim Fandango?
people_also_ask.heading: Originally, Schafer had come up with the name "Deeds of the Dead" for the game's title, as he had originally planned Manny to be a real estate agent in the Land of the Dead. Other potential titles included "The Long Siesta" and "Dirt Nap", before he came up with the title Grim Fandango.
people_also_ask.title: Grim Fandango - Wikipedia

people_also_ask.question: Will there be a Grim Fandango 2?
people_also_ask.heading: One of the main reasons Grim Fandango never received a sequel is quite simple: it's a point-and-click adventure game, part of a niche genre that fell out of fashion long ago.22-Dec-2020
people_also_ask.title: This Is Why There Was Never A Sequel To Grim Fandango

people_also_ask.question: What is glottis Grim Fandango?
people_also_ask.heading: Glottis is orange, 8-feet and 800-pound elemental created to drive (and repair) cars. He serves as much of the comic relief to the game. Numerous humorous elements, like the Bone Wagon, were designed entirely around his obsession with cars.
people_also_ask.title: Glottis | Grim Fandango Wiki

knowledge_panel.description: grim fandango is a 1998 adventure game directed by tim schafer and developed and published by lucasarts for microsoft windows. it is the first adventure game by lucasarts to use 3d computer graphics overlaid on pre-rendered static backgrounds. wikipedia
